Arnold's Classical Series has attained a circulation almos.) unparalleled, having been introduced into nearly all the leading educational institutions in the United States. The secret of this success is, that the author has hit upon the true system of teaching the ancient languages. He exhibits them not as dead, but as living tongues; and by imstation and repetition, the means which Nature herself points out to the child learn- ing his mother-tongue‚ he familiarizes the student with the idioms employed by the elegant writers and speakers of antiquity.
